gurmukhi: ਚੰਦਨ ਕੀ ਬਾਰਿ ਜੈਸੇ ਦੀਜੀਅਤ ਬਬੂਰ ਦ੍ਰੁਮ ਕੰਚਨ ਸੰਪਟ ਮਧਿ ਕਾਚੁ ਗਹਿ ਰਾਖੀਅੈ
transliteration: Chandan Kee Baari Jaisay Deejeeat Baboor Drouma , Kanchan Sanpat Madhi Kaachu Gahi Raakheeai ?
translation: Just as a plant of acacia is protected with the twigs of sandalwood or a glass crystal is stored in a gold box for safety.

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਹੰਸ ਪਾਸਿ ਬੈਠਿ ਬਾੲਿਸੁ ਗਰਬ ਕਰੈ ਮ੍ਰਿਗ ਪਤਿ ਭਵਨੁ ਮੈ ਜੰਬਕ ਭਲਾਖੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Hans Paasi Baitthi Baaisu Garab Karai , Mrig Pati Bhavanu Mai Janbak Bhalaakheeai ?
translation: just as a filth-eating crow expresses pride of his beauty and life-style or a jackal expresses his desire to go into the lion's den,

gurmukhi: ਜੈਸੇ ਗਰਧਬ ਗਜ ਪ੍ਰਤਿ ੳੁਪਹਾਸ ਕਰੈ ਚਕਵੈ ਕੋ ਚੋਰ ਡਾਂਡੇ ਦੂਧ ਮਦ ਮਾਖੀਅੈ
transliteration: Jaisay Garadhab Gaj Prati Oupahaas Karai , Chakavai Ko Chor Daanday Doodh Mad Maakheeai ?
translation: Just as a donkey makes fun of an elephant and an emperor be punished by a thief; wine expresses its anger on milk.

gurmukhi: ਸਾਧਨ ਦੁਰਾੲਿ ਕੈ ਅਸਾਧ ਅਪਰਾਧ ਕਰੈ ੳੁਲਟੀਅੈ ਚਾਲ ਕਲੀਕਾਲ ਭ੍ਰਮ ਭਾਖੀਅੈ ||੫੩੨||
transliteration: Saadhan Duraai Kai Asaadh Aparaadh Karai , Ulateeai Chaal Kaleekaal Bhram Bhaakheeai ?532?
translation: These are all the contrary moves of the dark age (Kalyug). The noble souls are suppressed while the culprits indulge in doing sins. (Vice and sins are rampant while noble souls are hiding themselves in this dark age).  (532)
